thread.title: North Dakota beats Lake Superior 5-2 in opener
thread.title_full: North Dakota beats Lake Superior 5-2 in opener

title: North Dakota beats Lake Superior 5-2 in opener
text:
North Dakota opens Berry era with 5-2 win over Lake Superior St. THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   7:20   7:20   
Subjects: 
Maine (365) 

PORTLAND, Maine â€” The Brad Berry era at North Dakota got off to a good start Friday as UND rallied from two goals down after a period to beat Lake Superior State 5-2 at the Ice Breaker Tournament. 
Bryn Chyzyk scored short-handed and into an empty net as North Dakota scored the game's last five goals. 
UND scored three times in the second period after falling behind 2-0 and having another Laker goal waved off. 
Berry replaced longtime UND coach Dave Hakstol, who took the team to the Frozen Four last season before leaving to coach the Philadelphia Flyers in the National Hockey League. 
Lake Superior's J.T. Henke and Mitch Hults scored early goals. 
North Dakota responded with second-period goals by Shane Gersich and Keaton Thompson and Austin Poganski.
